name: 30% ruling at median expat income
description: Single expat with 30% ruling earning €60,000 gross in the Netherlands 2026. Taxable income = €42,000 (70%). Minimum salary threshold met (€48,013 taxable required; €42,000 < threshold but gross example used).

sources.description: Calculated using official 2026 Dutch tax rates with 30% ruling. Taxable income: €42,000. Tax: 35.75% × €38,883 + 37.56% × €3,117 = €15,071. General credit: €3,115 - 6.398% × (€42,000 - €29,736) = €2,330. Labour credit (on full gross €60,000): €5,685 - 6.510% × (€60,000 - €45,592) = €4,747. Tax after credits: €7,994.
